importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. A stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on this day, which later became central to the investigation.

The Hyundai Accent was reportedly on fire on this date, and the vehicle was found at a junkyard, where it was compacted before investigation could proceed. This event is tied to alleged arson and vehicle theft charges against Keon King.

The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date behind an abandoned school, confirmed via DNA testing. This date marks the conclusion of the search and the official identification of the remains.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period around October 4, 2025, marks the start of the disappearance of Kada Scott and the initial sighting of the stolen Hyundai Accent, which was linked to Keon King’s movements and later found on fire.
Over the course of about two weeks, from Scott’s disappearance to the discovery of her remains, the investigation intensified, leading to the arrest of Keon King and confirmation of her death.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman, was found dead in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, with her remains confirmed by DNA testing.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and homicide. Bail was set at $2.5 million.
King’s cellphone movements correlated with Scott’s disappearance and he was found in locations tied to her last known whereabouts.
A stolen Hyundai Accent was seen on video parked near where Scott’s body was found and was later reported on fire, with evidence suggesting it may have been used in the crime.
The initial tip led investigators to the school but no remains were found; a follow-up tip prompted a return search that resulted in the discovery of Scott’s remains.
Prosecutors believe additional individuals may have been involved after the fact, and further investigation is ongoing.
Kada Scott, who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a source of light, kindness, and beautiful spirit; they expressed heartbreak over her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman who was reported missing in Philadelphia and whose remains were later discovered.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central victim of the case, and her discovery directly led to the investigation into Keon King’s alleged involvement in her disappearance and murder.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with multiple crimes related to Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect in the case, with evidence including cellphone data, video footage, and a stolen vehicle linking him to the crime scene.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city where Kada Scott was reported missing and where the remains were discovered.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The location of the crime and the jurisdiction where law enforcement actions took place, making it a central geographic and legal context for the case.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The hometown of Keon King, a suspect in the case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides background context for King’s residence and possible ties to the case, though the investigation is primarily focused on Philadelphia.

namedEntities.name: Black Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle linked to Keon King and the timeline of Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Its sighting near the scene of Scott’s death and subsequent fire are key pieces of forensic evidence connecting King to the crime.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The lead prosecutor in the case, responsible for charging Keon King and declaring intent to pursue homicide charges.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He publicly stated the investigation’s trajectory and the legal process, emphasizing adherence to constitutional standards and the possibility of future homicide charges.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who provided details about the tip, cellphone data, and video evidence in the case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided specific investigative insights, including how a follow-up tip led to the discovery of Scott’s remains and the significance of video evidence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, who had been missing for about two weeks, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia. Authorities say the discovery was prompted by an anonymous tip that led them to re-examine the area. DNA tests confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing a catastrophe. His cellphone activity and a stolen black Hyundai Accent—seen parked near the scene and later on fire—link him to Scott’s disappearance. Prosecutors believe other individuals may have been involved and are continuing to investigate. Though the initial charges were filed, District Attorney Larry Krasner stated homicide charges are under consideration, with an emphasis on legal process and constitutional protections. Scott’s parents expressed deep sorrow, remembering her as a source of light and kindness.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
